info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHEASTERN HUNTINGDON...NORTHEASTERN MIFFLIN...SOUTHEASTERN CENTRE...NORTH CENTRAL JUNIATA...SNYDER AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Selinsgrove to 20 miles southwest of Mifflinburg to near Lewistown. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Sunbury, Selinsgrove, Northumberland, Winfield, Burnham, Shamokin Dam, Milroy, Hummels Wharf, Middleburg, Yeagertown, Mcalisterville, McClure, Kreamer, Penns Creek, Beaver Springs, Reedsville, Richfield, Mount Pleasant Mills, Kratzerville and Paxtonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
